results.title: The Blackbird = La Merle (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Norman McLaren and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Norman McLaren imparts unusual activity to an old French-Canadian nonsense song. Simple white cut-outs on pastel backgrounds provide lively illustrations. The folksong, (Mon Merle), is sung in French by the Trio Lyrique of Montreal. This, the only white blackbird in creation, is a wonderful amalgam of Buster Keaton, Marcel Marceau and McLaren.

results.title: The Blackadder: The Queen of Spain's beard
results.brief_description: Three hilarious episodes of the well-known BBC series, “Black Adder” feature on this compilation video: “The Queen of Spain’s Beard”; “The Black Seal”; and “Witchsmeller Pursuivant”. Stars Rowan Atkinson with guest appearances by Frank Finlay and Rik Mayall.

results.title: The Black swan
results.brief_description: The life history of the majestic black swan is depicted in its natural surroundings of swampland at the edge of lakes and lagoons. The nest which is made on reeds and twigs or any slight elevation in the swamp is defended against all comers. From 2-6 eggs are hatched and the cygnets take at once to the water. By six weeks they are almost adult and able to look after themselves. Swans are nomads and when heavy rain swamps their home they fly off to seek a new one. Scenes are included of other water birds such as pelicans, swamp hens and egrets. No other credits available.

results.title: The Black swan
results.creator_credit: Henry King, Robert Bassler and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: This is the story of the Spanish Main - when villainy wore a sash and the only political creed in the world was - Love, Gold and Adventure! Tyrone Power is a swashbucking rogue pirate who pillages galleons and towns in the company of Henry Morgan (Laird Cregar). When Morgan is elected Govenor of Jamaica, some of his pirate Captains continue their villainous ways, especially Redbeard (George Sanders). Power falls in love with the beautiful daughter (Maureen O’Hara) of the former Govenor and decides to reform which pits him against Redbeard. “The Black Swan” is a classic of its kind, with magnificent settings, swordplay, bravura acting and excitingly staged action sequences involving 17th Century ships and an enormous amount of cannon fire! Leon Shamroy’s cinematography deservedly earned him an Oscar. Based on the novel by Rafael Sabatini.

results.title: The Black Stallion Returns
results.creator_credit: Robert Dalva, Francis Ford Coppola, Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer and Zoetrope Studios
results.brief_description: A youth named Alec and a fabled Arabian steed survived a shipwreck and became inseparable friends in The Black Stallion, the first of Walter Farley’s 16-book series to be made into a highly successful film. In the sequel The Black Stallion returns, the horse is reclaimed by its rightful owner, beginning an odyssey to North Africa and a culture alien to Alec. Through his persistence, Alec gains new insights into courage, perseverance and honour. This action-filled adventure tale joins the initial film as a timeless classic. Stars Kelly Reno and Ferdy Mayne

images.caption: The Black Stallion Returns (Robert Dalva) still

results.title: The Black stallion
results.creator_credit: Carroll Ballard, Francis Ford Coppola, Omni Zoetrope and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description: A young boy is saved from a devastating shipwreck by a beautiful black stallion. Together they survive on an isolated island, an experience that creates a lasting bond between them. After their rescue, they return to America where they meet Henry Dailey (Mickey Rooney) an irascible ex-jockey and horse trainer. Dailey is quick to realise the racing potential of the stallion and teaches the boy to be a jockey. Based on the novel by Walter Farley the film stars Kelly Reno, Mickey Reno and Teri Garr.

results.title: The Black pages
results.brief_description: Stunning yet restrained cinematography is a feature of this beautifully lit work which demonstrates controlled use of colour in a piece employing controlled kinetic movement within the frame. Considered visual composition and a strong soundtrack support an intriguing storyline.

results.title: The Black man and his bride
results.creator_credit: Tim Burstall, Patrick Ryan and Eltham Films
results.brief_description: By using camera movement and editing technique the film animates the series of paintings “The Black Man and his Bride”, by Arthur Boyd, which tells the story of an aborigine and his half-caste bride. Tim Burstall also wrote the original ballad sung to guitar accompaniment which runs for the duration of the film sung by Donald Ayrton.
